title: support just cant carry a game
body:
i feel like support characters are the worse in lol.

Any other roles gets 2 kills and then can snowball and carry the game. JG mid and top all can dominate the game if they just get a 2 kill lead at start.

Then we get to support. 2 kills on them is nothing. They barely get any stronger and they dont have much impact on the game. Yeah i get they are there to help adc get kills, but if team falls behind, support can only really do CC or try make plays, but cant carry.

They are forced to try get their adc kills, which makes there adc strong and then the adc can carry. but no love for support.
And if support is the best player on the team, then that makes it a lot harder.

I have seen a top carry, mid carry, jg carrry, adc carry. 
Support carry is rare.

and yes i get the whole, dont play support, but Im just thinking here about a clear issue with support characters.

From
-was a support main

replies.body:
yes you can, if you think that then you're probably not playing support efficiently then. I'm also laughing hard at the statement 'They are forced to try get their adc kills' that is the stupidest thing to do unless you're super high ELO where people can effectively use advantages consistently.

Why else do you think blitz incurs such high ban rates L0L 

your definition of 'carrying' is so distorted that it's delusional.

What if you do play your fullest potential and still cant carry? I've had countless games where i wardrd everything, cc-ed and peel to the best i could and still lose because hey we're humans and my team decide lets throw the game by doing stupid stuff aka aim the tank or 1v5. Consider both sides lol

It all depends on what you mean by 'carry'.

For example a fed Katarina can 1v3, and thats called 'carrying'

But a skilled Thresh who can simultaneously prevent the enemy backline from escaping as well as consistently keep the enemy frontline away from the allied backline. Is arguably a bigger asset to the team than the fed Kat.

A god Thresh can look out for the whole team and make up for shitty players, but a god mid laner or ADC can only look out for themselves, so if their team is bad and there is no one to follow up on their plays, they have less of an impact.

A fed Thresh cant 1v1 an enemy Fiora. But he can hold Fiora off long enough for a crappy Lucian to kill her.

A fed carry brings 1 good player up above the level of the enemy players.
A fed support brings 4 bad players up to the same level as the enemy players.

So they have different purposes.

But to be fair, some supports are prone to carrying, others... less so.
Thresh/Blitz/Lulu/Raka etc can carry pretty easily.
While Bard or Janna might find it a bit harder.
Which is the same in other lanes too, for example a Riven or Trynd is more likely to carry than a Gnar or Mundo.

the thing now in lower elo is that u can get feeders and throwers almost everyday.Yes they can hold them there for as long as they want. but what if ur adc just nv come? he just run to 1v4 and die there? i feel the word carring here is more like who can actually 1v5 cause in low elo like bronze(like me xd)your teammate dont listen they dont help when they play bad they either just go fed the opponent or afk and toxic talk.I feel its more of a bigger problem in lower elo and its farely a big one.sup is not really useful in low elos.trust me xd, U dont know what bronze&Iron 2019 is like

i agree with you, but a few points, 1, fiora would kill shitty lucian anyway
2, bard support, i have had way easier times carrying than with raka

Thankfully, the rareness of support mains in low ranked games means you usually have the luxury of being up against an annoyed autofill victim, with no idea about how to play the role.  This certainly makes carrying easier.  I had an account that started b5, and after trying all sorts of positions on it, I actually was doing better at support (not my main role on my main acct by any means) than at anything else.

Supports are the people who normally win bot lane, they just don't get the kill, they land the cc and wait for the damage to right click somewhere in the vicinity of the immobilized enemy.  Watch some high level support streams for examples.

I've seen Brand supports who carry games just by landing their combos or even a few spells. 

Once they get a good lead in lane they usually can one shot squishes on the enemy team.

Good Thresh players who can curve their hooks are a nightmare to lane against so I must say if you're good at Thresh or landing hooks pick Thresh.

Thresh, supp, i can carry a 3v5 if i need to, reason being (aside from the fact that i play him way too much) an ignite, with ad scaling runes and the right masteries, can easily secure kills if need be, and should your adc be complete garbage you can just go AD thresh and carry from that, i believe this also works for leo (ad or ap) and critzcrank

But other than the tanks, i don't think the squishy healer supports can do anything

and the mage supports just play them as if you were playing them mid = carry

Yeah i wanted to compare a fed support to a fed any other role in the poll, but ran out of space.


I mean if you could have a pro in your team to play any role, and you wanted to climb really fast, would you put him as support?

or if a friend asked, what role should I get really good at to climb solo q, would you say, yeah support is good for climbing?

I mean play the role that makes it most fun. But playing support means you have to rely on others. No real solid way to carry.

I just think that is a limitation that is put on support and not any other role.
getting fed as support is good for dragging jungler attention and the likes, it will also lead the other team tothink the way you are and ever so slightly underestimate your streangth

neither, a supports job is to buff and, well, support the team, a support can turn a can, but not necesarily carry, supports like sion and leona can turn fights in the teams favour, they serve their role, their role isnt to carry, its to support, especially the adc, the poll isnt entirely correct also, their is middle ground, including the fact that a fed enemy will kill more than the support, and yes other lanes can snowball, but supports, roaming or not can help snowballers go further, the truth is that more often than not when you see an enemy fed adc (or whoever is in the botlane with the support {{champion:115}} ) you dont think, hey, their support was really good (its thought sometimes), you think, hey, their adc is really good/op, its so stupid that they are too good / their champ is too op.
